sentences.sContent: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
sentences.sCn: 我想他50岁左右，不过也只是猜测。

sentences.sContent: What star sign are you? No, let me guess .
sentences.sCn: 你是什么星座的？别说，让我来猜猜看。

sentences.sContent: ...I guess she overheard her grandfather and me talking about how we're worried about how we're going to get to Houston...
...I guess it's pretty obvious what you'll be doing most of today...
...I guess most of the people in the class are in the same situation...
...So I guess I should leave it out...
...I guess I'd sell my watch or computer or do some odd jobs till I could afford a return plane ticket...
...I guess he'd forgotten he used the same excuse when he called his boss from my house...
...I guess I haven’t spent much time exercising lately...
...I guess it’s something I haven’t acquired a taste for yet...

phrases.pCn: 猜怎么了；猜猜看；猜怎么着
难以预料；谁也猜不准的事情

words.tran: 猜测；臆测；凭猜测所作之工作

trans.tranOther: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
